decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to leverage the infect mechanic to quickly and efficiently deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck includes creatures with infect, such as Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, along with ways to give them additional power and evasion, such as Berserk and Vines of Vastwood. It also includes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection, and counterspells like Daze and Force of Will for disruption. The deck aims to create a fast and aggressive strategy that can overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to neutralize the infect threats.

The deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Wasteland and Daze. The deck also has a strong equipment package with Stoneforge Mystic and Batterskull, providing additional threats and life gain. By combining efficient creatures, disruption spells, and powerful equipment, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and secure a quick victory before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck revolves around a combination of control elements and powerful equipment to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient threats like True-Name Nemesis. The deck aims to control the game through card advantage and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while also utilizing Stoneforge Mystic to tutor for equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to further solidify its board presence. Overall, the deck seeks to control the game and out-value the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire library and win the game. The deck also includes cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Baleful Strix to control the board and protect the combo. It uses a variety of tutors such as Imperial Recruiter and Transmute Artifact to find key pieces, and efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck is designed to manipulate the top of the library using Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance to control the flow of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently cheat big creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience. The deck includes a lot of cantrips like Preordain, Ponder, and Brainstorm to dig for combo pieces, as well as interaction cards like Force of Will to protect the combo. Cunning Wish allows for versatility in finding sideboard cards when needed. The mana base is streamlined to support the combo while also providing acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of countermagic, hand disruption, and removal spells while utilizing powerful creatures and equipment to close out the game. The deck focuses on using cards like Stoneforge Mystic to search for and cheat out powerful artifacts like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, while also employing cards like True-Name Nemesis and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional threats and card advantage. The mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland and disruption from cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will helps the deck disrupt opponents' game plans and maintain control of the game.

This deck focuses on using a combination of spells like Counterspell, Brainstorm, Counterbalance, Sensei's Divining Top, and Force of Will to control the opponent's plays and disrupt their strategy. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Venser, Shaper Savant, along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus. The deck aims to outmaneuver opponents through card advantage, disruption, and timely removal, ultimately gaining control of the game and setting up for powerful finishers like Entreat the Angels and Vendilion Clique.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage provided by Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Sensei's Divining Top. The deck aims to manipulate the top of the deck with Counterbalance and Terminus to control the board state and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Entreat the Angels provides a win condition in the late game. The inclusion of versatile sideboard cards allows for adaptation to different matchups, making the deck a strong choice for a control player in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland, Hymn to Tourach, and Abrupt Decay, while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman. The deck aims to control the game through countermagic such as Force of Will and Daze, while also generating card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Sylvan Library. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides additional value and control elements to the deck.

The deck revolves around casting multiple low-cost spells in a single turn to generate storm count and then finish the opponent off with a lethal Tendrils of Agony. This is achieved through a combination of powerful rituals, card draw spells such as Brainstorm and Ponder, and the ability to search for key pieces with cards like Infernal Tutor and Grim Tutor. The goal is to quickly assemble the necessary resources to create a large storm count and cast Tendrils of Agony for lethal damage.

The main concept of this deck is to put early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and land destruction. Canadian Threshold focuses on playing low-cost threats like Delver of Secrets and Nimble Mongoose while using cards like Stifle and Wasteland to slow down the opponent. The deck aims to control the board while dealing damage quickly with efficient spells like Lightning Bolt. By maintaining a balance between aggression and disruption, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control through a combination of powerful planeswalkers, disruptive spells, and efficient creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while deploying threats like Stoneforge Mystic, True-Name Nemesis, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to pressure the opponent and generate advantage. The mana base is built to support the deck's three colors and maximize its ability to cast its spells consistently. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory through resource advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of lands and spells. By using cards like Crop Rotation, Life from the Loam, and Exploration, the player can quickly assemble powerful land combinations like Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage or The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale/Glacial Chasm. Additionally, the deck contains cards like Punishing Fire and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain control of the game. Overall, this deck aims to utilize its lands and spells to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent in a battle of attrition.

This deck aims to quickly put powerful creatures like Emrakul and Griselbrand into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It utilizes card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to set up the combo pieces, while also running countermagic in the form of Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. Additionally, it includes Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and manipulation, and utilizes fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and City of Traitors to accelerate the deployment of its threats.

Utilizing a combination of disruptive spells and powerful creatures, this deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage to the opponent. By leveraging hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, along with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Diabolic Edict, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan. Meanwhile, threats like True-Name Nemesis and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide a clock for the opponent to deal with. The deck's mana base allows for consistent access to the necessary colors while also providing options for land destruction with cards like Wasteland.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to control and manipulate the game through powerful counterspells and removal spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Counterbalance and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also focuses on card advantage and consistency with cards like Brainstorm and Sensei's Divining Top. The win condition is to either control the board until Entreat the Angels can overwhelm the opponent or utilize Terminus to sweep the board.
